cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: turning north tonight and then north-northeast on Friday, tracking toward the southwest Louisiana coast and then inland across central Louisiana toward Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast between Cameron and Morgan City

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of the mouth of the Pearl River to Bay St. Louis, MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: High Island, TX to Morgan City, LA (Hurricane) and east of Morgan City, LA to the mouth of the Pearl River including New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas (Tropical Storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas upper coast through all of Louisiana and into coastal Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely; a 25% chance of 50-kt (58 mph) winds and a 7% chance of hurricane-force gusts exist for the port area late Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge of 2–4 ft is possible in the lower Mississippi River and connected lakes (including Lake Maurepas) which can propagate upriver toward the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain with isolated 15-inch pockets expected across south-central Louisiana, capable of flash and river flooding in the Baton Rouge area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous lightning, prolonged power outages, and river level rises that could disrupt terminal and rail access.
